info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 6:19PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Henderson and northeastern Greenville Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 619 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles south of Hendersonville, or 5 miles south of Flat Rock, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Saluda, Tigerville, Pleasant Ridge State Park, Flat Rock, Slater-Marietta, Travelers Rest, Jones Gap State Park, Tuxedo, North Saluda Reservoir and Glassy Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
